intro: Launaea bellidifolia, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its robust, branched stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers, which bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots and the ability to store water in its thick leaves. Launaea bellidifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
